perturbation.changed_text:
18.1   During the term of this Agreement, all the Parties to this Agreement shall take reasonable steps to
prevent disclosure of any confidential or proprietary information to any third party, which it may have received from the JVC or other Parties
to this Agreement. They shall use for any purpose (even if not authorized by the supplying party) the confidential information marked or designated as “confidential”, except for the following information:
perturbation.explanation: Original text stated that the confidentiality clause extended for three years after the termination of the agreement. The modified version removes this restriction. By changing “and for a period of three (3) years thereafter” to simply “during the term of this agreement,” the confidentiality obligations are now limited to the agreement’s duration. This creates uncertainty about post-termination confidentiality.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless
terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for a period of five (5) years thereafter unless
terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies an indefinite term, while the modified version limits it to five years. This creates a direct contradiction, as one clause suggests the agreement continues indefinitely unless terminated, while the other mandates termination after five years.

perturbation.original_text:
8.3 a) IMPCO, at its sole discretion and without any legal obligation may assist the JVC with the following:
 
i) Sales and service training
 ii) After sales services .
perturbation.changed_text:
8.3 a) IMPCO, at its sole discretion and without any legal obligation must assist the JVC with the following:
 
i) Sales and service training
 ii) After sales services .
perturbation.explanation: By changing "may assist" to "must assist", we create an in-text contradiction. The original text clearly gives IMPCO the discretion to assist the JVC, however, the modified text states IMPCO has a legal obligation to assist the JVC. It is unclear now whether assistance is on an optional basis or mandatory.
